name: 施岳廷
objective: This course aims to teach students to develop a fundamental understanding of ceramic processing. The organization of course will follow the typical ceramic processing in laboratory or industry. Starting from the powder synthesis and characterization, followed by powder processing, then various forming and sintering techniques will be discussed.
schedule:
1. Powder synthesis and characterization (4 weeks)
2. Powder processing (5 weeks)
3. Ceramic forming processes (3 weeks)
4. Sintering (4 weeks)
materials:
1.	J. S. Reed, Principles of Ceramics Processing. (Wiley, 1995).
2.	W. D. Kingery, H. K. Bowen and D. R. Uhlmann, Introduction to Ceramics. (Wiley, 1976).
3.	Y. M. Chiang, D. P. Birnie and W. D. Kingery, Physical Ceramics: Principles for Ceramic Science and Engineering. (Wiley, 1996).
